data.q: What does ES Modules support in modern browsers?
data.explanation: ES Modules provide native support for dependency management using import and export.

data.q: Which attribute enables ES module support in browsers?
data.explanation: Scripts with type="module" enable ES module syntax in browsers.

data.q: Which statement is used to export a value from a module?
data.explanation: The export keyword makes variables or functions available to other modules.

data.q: How are ES modules loaded by default in browsers?
data.explanation: ES modules are deferred by default, similar to scripts with the defer attribute.

data.q: Which keyword imports a default export?
data.explanation: Default exports are imported without curly braces.

data.q: Which feature helps avoid global namespace pollution?
data.explanation: ES Modules encapsulate code and prevent leaking variables into the global scope.

data.q: Which statement about ES modules is true?
o: They require a build step to work in browsers
They execute in the global scope
data.explanation: ES Modules support circular dependencies and have well-defined loading behavior.
